data.title: Data list
data.subTitle: The data list component displays a group of related data in a consistent and easy to consume way.

data.title: Data table
data.subTitle: Use a data table to organise and display large quantities of related data.

data.title: Action chip
data.subTitle: Action chips are functional versions of Chips.

data.title: Alert
data.subTitle: Alerts display a short important message in a way that attracts attention without interrupting the current task.

data.title: Badge
data.subTitle: Badges are attached to other components to provide an indication that something new is available, or that something has changed.

data.title: Chip
data.subTitle: Chips help people view summary information, filter data or trigger actions.

data.title: Dialog
data.subTitle: Dialogs are modal windows that interrupt the user's current task to bring something important to attention.

data.title: Empty state
data.subTitle: Use the empty state component when there is no content to display. It provides a consistent way of communicating to people what to do next.

data.title: Loading indicator
data.subTitle: Loading indicators help inform users that a request is being processed. Radial and linear indicators provide flexibility in design.

data.title: Skeleton
data.subTitle: Skeleton loading states are representations of the shape of content that help inform users that a specific type of component is loading.

data.title: Status tag
data.subTitle: Status tags are short, clear and digestible ways to display the status of something on the page.

data.title: Stepper
data.subTitle: A stepper is a visual representation of a user's progress through a predefined set of steps in a linear process.

data.title: Toast
data.subTitle: Toasts give brief, non-critical updates about events that happen in an app. Toasts are sometimes called 'snackbars'.

data.title: Tooltip
data.subTitle: Tooltips provide helpful information when the cursor hovers over an element or when focus is applied.

data.title: Button
data.subTitle: Buttons are used to allow or encourage people to take an action.

data.title: Checkbox
data.subTitle: Use checkboxes as part of a form, in dialogs or in control areas such as filters or settings.

data.title: Date input
data.subTitle: A date input is used when gathering a specific date in a text-based format.

data.title: Date picker
data.subTitle: A date picker is a type of drop-down control that allows people to easily view and select dates.

data.title: Radio button
data.subTitle: Radio buttons let people select a single option from a list.

data.title: Search bar
data.subTitle: A search bar is a special input field that allows users to search for information using keywords or phrases.

data.title: Select
data.subTitle: Selects allow users to select one or more values from a list of options.

data.title: Switch
data.subTitle: Switches are used to quickly toggle an option on or off.

data.title: Text field
data.subTitle: Text fields let users input and edit text. Text fields capture a single line of text and text areas capture multiple lines of text.

data.title: Time input
data.subTitle: Time input allows users to enter a specific time in a standardised format for scheduling or time-based tasks.

data.title: Toggle button
data.subTitle: Toggle buttons provide an action capable of indicating a state. They are commonly used for turning settings either ‘on’ or ‘off’.

data.title: Accordion
data.subTitle: Accordions are expandable and collapsible sections that are used to show and hide additional content.

data.title: Card (horizontal)
data.subTitle: Horizontal cards are containers used to display structured information or link to new information in a horizontal layout.

data.title: Card (vertical)
data.subTitle: Cards are containers used to display structured information or interactive content.

data.title: Divider
data.subTitle: Dividers are used to separate different elements in groups of content. Visually, they look like rules or lines.

data.title: Footer
data.subTitle: Footers are placed at the bottom of the page and can be used for additional links not found in the main navigation.

data.title: Layout grid
data.subTitle: Layout grids arrange content into a flexible, consistent structure that adapts across screen sizes.

data.title: Section container
data.subTitle: Use the section container component to consistently align content within an app.

data.title: Back to top
data.subTitle: The back to top component helps people quickly return to the top of a long page.

data.title: Breadcrumb
data.subTitle: Breadcrumbs show someone where they are in an app’s hierarchy and provide a secondary method of navigating back to parent pages.

data.title: Hero
data.subTitle: A large banner found at the top of page used to introduce page content, provide key actions and add personality.

data.title: Link
data.subTitle: Links can be used to navigate to different pages or sections of a page.

data.title: Page header
data.subTitle: A page header defines the top of the page content and is a consistent way to show page context, key actions and secondary navigation.

data.title: Pagination bar
data.subTitle: Use the pagination bar when large amounts of content are split across multiple pages and various pagination options are required.

data.title: Pagination
data.subTitle: Use pagination to split large amounts of content into pages and navigate between them.

data.title: Popover menu
data.subTitle: Use popover menus to place actions inside a menu that overlays other page content when opened.

data.title: Side navigation
data.subTitle: Side navigation provides an app's main navigation and is fixed on the left-hand side of the app. It includes the app's name, main navigation and optional secondary links.

data.title: Skip link
data.subTitle: Skip links are used to bypass repetitive blocks of content and interface and go directly to the main content of a page.

data.title: Table of contents
data.subTitle: A table of contents allows users to quickly navigate through a page's content using links to its headings.

data.title: Tabs
data.subTitle: Tabs let users navigate between content within the same context. Tabs organise complex layouts by separating content into multiple sections.

data.title: Top navigation
data.subTitle: Top navigation sits across the top of the page. It includes the app name, search bar, main navigation and secondary links.

data.title: Tree view
data.subTitle: Use the tree view component to display hierarchical data, or provide navigation, within a tree structure.

data.title: Theme
data.subTitle: How to change the theme and brand colours of some components.

data.title: Classification banner
data.subTitle: Classification banners are used to show the data classification (also known as protective marking) of an app.

data.title: Typography
data.subTitle: Use the typography component for consistent styling across typographical elements.
